message.content:
cs.NE, cs.EM, cs.MM, cs.MA, cs.CV 

The paper discusses the use of artificial synapses and neural networks, which are typically studied in the field of machine learning and artificial intelligence (cs.NE). The use of circularly-polarized ultrashort optical pulses to manipulate magnetization state falls under the category of electromagnetism (cs.EM) and micromagnetics (cs.MM). The optimization of synaptic weights using a global feedback mechanism involves mathematical optimization techniques, which are studied in the field of mathematical analysis (cs.MA). Finally, the implementation of supervised learning on an opto-magnetic neural network involves computer vision techniques (cs.CV).
